validationRules.labelss: Required - Field label displayed to user
validationRules.reqTgl: Optional - Set true for required field (adds asterisk to label)
validationRules.valName: Optional - Set true to enable name validation
validationRules.nameIcons: Required if nameIconType='fontAwesome' - Font Awesome class
validationRules.nameImage: Required if nameIconType='image' - Object with url and Id
validationRules.hlpTxt: Optional - Must be true to enable help text
validationRules.desctxt: Required if hlpTxt=true - Help text content

warnings: ‚ö†Ô∏è PARENT REQUIRED: nxt-name-field MUST be placed inside tp-form-block (ancestor requirement)
‚ö†Ô∏è ICON TYPE: nameIconType must be set before nameIcons or nameImage will work
‚ö†Ô∏è AUTOCOMPLETE: Use 'given-name' and 'family-name' for split name fields, not 'name'
‚ö†Ô∏è WIDTH PAIRING: When using split names (first+last), ensure widths add up correctly (e.g., 48% + 48% + 4% gap = 100%)
‚ö†Ô∏è HELP TEXT: hlpTxt must be true for desctxt to display
‚ö†Ô∏è VALIDATION: valName and maxAlphabets work together - valName enables validation, maxAlphabets sets limit
‚ö†Ô∏è STYLING: Label, input, button styling controlled by parent tp-form-block (lblClr, inpClr, etc.)
‚ö†Ô∏è ERROR MESSAGE: Custom error message only shows when reqTgl=true and field is empty on submit
‚ö†Ô∏è PLACEHOLDER vs LABEL: Both are useful - placeholder guides input format, label identifies field purpose
‚ö†Ô∏è RESPONSIVE WIDTH: inpSz uses md/sm/xs breakpoints - always set mobile (xs) to 100% for better UX
‚ö†Ô∏è ICON COLOR: icnClr and hvrIcnClr only work with nameIconType='fontAwesome', not with image icons
‚ö†Ô∏è IMAGE ICON SIZE: Custom image icons should be 24x24px or 32x32px for optimal display
‚ö†Ô∏è CHARACTER LIMIT: maxAlphabets is a string, not a number (e.g., '50', not 50)
commonMistakes: ‚ùå Forgetting to set nameIconType before adding icon (icons won't appear)
‚ùå Using autoComplete='name' for split first/last fields (use 'given-name' and 'family-name')
‚ùå Setting hlpTxt=false but adding desctxt (help text won't show)
‚ùå Using inpSz widths that don't account for gap spacing (e.g., 50% + 50% = 100%, but gap adds extra space causing wrapping)
‚ùå Setting maxAlphabets without valName=true (limit won't be enforced)
‚ùå Using number for maxAlphabets instead of string (should be '50', not 50)
‚ùå Expecting icon color change with image icons (only works with fontAwesome)
‚ùå Not testing responsive widths on mobile (fields should be full-width on xs breakpoint)
‚ùå Using vague error messages like 'Required' instead of specific 'Please enter your name'
‚ùå Placing name field outside tp-form-block parent (block won't render correctly)
‚ùå Not setting autoComplete (missing out on browser autofill UX improvement)
bestPractices: ‚úÖ Always set autoComplete for better UX (browser autofill saves user time)
‚úÖ Use specific autocomplete values: 'given-name' for first name, 'family-name' for last name
‚úÖ Keep labels concise (2-3 words max): 'Full Name' not 'Please Enter Your Full Name Here'
‚úÖ Use placeholders for format guidance: 'e.g., John Smith' helps users understand expected format
‚úÖ Add help text for complex requirements: 'Enter legal name as it appears on ID'
‚úÖ Position help text strategically: 'top' for upfront instructions, 'bottom' for additional context
‚úÖ Set character limits appropriate to use case: 50 for standard names, 75 for names with middle names, 100 for very long names
‚úÖ Use icons consistently across form (if name has icon, email/phone should too)
‚úÖ Choose icons that match context: fa-user for general, fa-id-card for official forms
‚úÖ Provide clear, specific error messages: 'First name is required' not 'Error'
‚úÖ Make name fields full-width on mobile (inpSz.xs = '100')
‚úÖ For split names, use consistent width patterns: 48%/48% on desktop, 100% on mobile
‚úÖ Enable name validation (valName) for data quality, especially in professional contexts
‚úÖ Use descPoss='bottom' for help text by default (doesn't interfere with label reading flow)
‚úÖ Test with long names (75+ characters) to ensure form doesn't break
‚úÖ Consider cultural naming conventions (not all names follow first/middle/last pattern)

accessibilityNotes: üåê WCAG 2.1 AA Compliance:
- Label must be descriptive and associated with input (labelss attribute)
- Error messages should be specific and actionable (error attribute)
- Required fields marked with asterisk (*) via reqTgl
- Help text provides additional context for screen readers (desctxt)
- Placeholder text supplements label, doesn't replace it
- autocomplete attribute improves assistive technology experience
üéØ Focus States:
- Parent tp-form-block controls focus styling (actInpBg, actInpBdr)
- Ensure focus state has 3:1 contrast ratio with background
‚å®Ô∏è Keyboard Navigation:
- Tab key moves between fields naturally
- Enter key submits form (handled by parent tp-form-block)
üîä Screen Reader Considerations:
- Label read first: 'Full Name, required, edit text'
- Help text read as description
- Error message announced on validation failure
- Icon decorative only (not announced)
üåà Color Contrast:
- Label text must have 4.5:1 contrast with background
- Placeholder text must have 4.5:1 contrast
- Icon color (icnClr) should have 3:1 contrast if conveying information
- Error messages typically red, but must have sufficient contrast

Help text styling (typically inherits from parent typography)
workflow: 5. Child inherits parent styling, overrides with child-specific settings
